column3: (file format explainer)->
column4:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first four will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
  - The fourth column is an optional metadata column

column3: NonDialogueFontScale

column1: Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all non-dialogue text, 1.0 for full size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, 1.0 for full size.
column7: The author(s) of this file, will appear in credits

column2: Orig
column3: Translation

column2: S-s-s-s-so... c-cold...
column3: 真-真-真-真-真冷...

column2: S-s-so... w-warm...
column3: 真-真-真-真-真暖和...

column2: Th-thanks for thawing me out.
column3: 谢-谢-谢谢你帮我解冻.

column2: I wish I had a bu-bu-bucket of lava to keep me warm.
column3: 真希望我有一-一-一-一-一桶岩浆帮我取暖.

column2: Fingers... g-g-getting co-cold already.
column3: 手指头...冻-冻-冻上了.

column2: Can you h-h-help me find a b-b-bucket?
column3: 能帮-帮-帮我找一个-个-个[桶]吗?

column2: You need a k-k-key? I've got one r-r-right here.
column3: 你需要钥-钥-钥-钥匙?这里...

column2: Ah shoot, my f-f-fingers are still f-frozen.
column3: 我-我-我的手还-还-还-还冻着.

column2: If you bring me a b-b-bucket and fill it with la-v-va, I can grab that k-key.
column3: 如果你带来一-一-一桶岩浆,我也许把钥匙拿-拿-拿给你.

column2: N-n-now we just need to <wavy>pour</wavy> in some l-l-lava.
column3: 现-现-现在我们只需要<wavy>把岩浆倒进去</wavy>.

column2: Ah that feels g-g-good... but it won't last like this. N-need to <wavy>pour</wavy> lava in the b-bucket.
column3: 太-太-太-太好了...能不能把岩浆<wavy>倒进桶里</wavy>?

column2: I can f-f-feel my hands again!
column3: 我又能感-感-感觉到手指头了!

column2: Take this key to the basement, I'm sure there's s-so-some-thing cool in there.
column3: 边上的[仓库]可以用这把钥匙打开,里面肯-肯-肯定又好东西.

column2: Now h-h-ho-how do I get down from here.
column3: 我-我-我该怎么下-下-下去?

column2: Ug-g-g-g-ghh it's so c-c-old here...
column3: 呃...这-这-这里好冷...

column2: Is he ready-ddy yet?
column3: 楼上那个怪人,他-他-他-他准备好了-了吗?

column2: W-w-woah! It fell through!
column3: 喔-喔-哇!掉下去了!

column2: Looks li-like the c-cart stayed safe too.
column3: 看起来矿-矿-矿车没-没摔坏.

column2: Oi, I've been breaking me back breaking these crates...
column3: 嘿,那边的,这些箱子把我累坏了...

column2: The last rock I threw broke. Ye don't have anything else to break crates do ye?
column3: 你有没有什么开箱工具?这些小石块根本不管用.

column2: Something large and heavy should do the trick.
column3: 我需要一个又[大]又[重]的东西.

column2: Oi that bucket looks heavy. Not heavy enough to break a crate, though.
column3: 嘿,那个[铁桶]挺结实的.不过还不够[重]!

column2: That was a smashingly good idea!
column3: 一个"破"天荒的好点子!

column2: Oh. Door's still locked, huh. Can't smash that...
column3: 哦.门还锁着...砸不开.

column2: I reckon someone 'round here should have that key.
column3: 钥匙估计还在哪个本地人的手里.

column2: Ye found the key!
column3: 你找到了钥匙!

column2: Still need something to break that crate though. Some kinda... large... heavy object.
column3: 还需要一个能砸开木箱的--又大,又沉的东西.

column2: Some kinda large, heavy, metal, throwable object.
column3: 一个...大的,很有分量的,能[扔]的东西.

column2: To be quite frank, I reckon some sorta anchor would do wonders.
column3: 说实话,一个[船锚]再好不过了--

column2: I used to break crates with anchors all the time back in my swashbuckling days.
column3: --我以前在海上"工作"过,经常用船锚开箱子.

column2: They worked wonders, waaayyyy better than all the other large, heavy, metal throwable objects we had.
column3: 它们可好用了.

column2: Alroight, now we're in buisness.
column3: 好的,我们开工!

column2: Oi, where are you taking that?
column3: 嘿,你要把它拿到哪里?

column2: Work sure is hard.
column3: 工作真难,已经三点几了.

column2: I could really go for a hot cocoa.
column3: 我真想饮一杯[热可可].

column2: You took a shortcut through the ice with the anchor? Alroighty.
column3: 你用船锚找到了穿过冰面的捷径?好样的.

column2: Boss spent all that time on the two-way elevator, but now...
column3: 老大在那个"双向"电梯上废了好大功夫了,现在...

column2: Our transit cycles will be faster than ever dropping through the ice!
column3: 直接跳下去比坐电梯快多了!

column2: She'll be over the moon when she hears about this.
column3: 老大她一定会很开心的.

column2:
Finally! A 
warm drink.
column3:
终于!我
的热饮!

column2: yoooo dude.
column3: 嘿--哥们!

column2: that pipe supplying the heater with lava is broken. sooo lame.
column3: 那边的[岩浆供热管]坏掉了.

column2: my boss had a new one but she's totally vanished bro.
column3: 老大之前买了个备用的,但是她[消失]了,我不知道管子放在哪里!

column2: dont even worry about the pipe well fix it later. go find someone who works harder.
column3: 算了,先别管管子的事了.

column2: you did it my dude.
column3: 哥们,你做到了!

column2: you should tell that crystal scientist lady about this
column3: 你该告诉那个鼓捣水晶的科学家.

column2: go enjoy making that goooooo. or whatever they do there.
column3: 去研究你那个什么燃料油吧.

column2: duuuuude thanks for fixing the world and stuff.
column3: 兄--弟,谢谢你修--复世界...之类的.

column2: wooow you got the thing spining with no heater? niiiice.
column3: 哇,你不用供热就把那玩意转起来了?漂亮.

column2: we reaaaaally gotta find my boss so we can fix this pipe.
column3: 我们真—的需要找到老大,好把管子修好.

column2: a scientist? crystals? dude what do all those words mean i just watch this pipe here.
column3: 科学家?水晶?兄弟,我只是看守管子的..

column2: oh heeeey you found the boss lady. good work dude.
column3: 哦嘿—你找到老大了.好样的哥们.

column2: she give us the pipe? brooo you gotta be a better negotiator.
column3: 她把管子给你了?呃...你可"真会"沟通.

column2: you gotta get that pipe my guy or the heater will be broken foreeeeever
column3: 哥们,再拿不到管子这个加热器要永--远坏掉了.

column2: yooooo you found the pipe.
column3: 嘿!你找到了水管.

column2: put it in bro.
column3: 把它安上去,兄弟!

column2: niceeee now we need two cartfuls of lava in the machine to fill the heater.
column3: 好--的...现在只需要[两矿车岩浆]来启动加热器.

column2: that giant ice patch shortcut should help its rad
column3: 那个大冰面上的[捷径]太酷了,它一定有所用途.

column2: luckily the lava isnt unstable like crystals you can move tiles or whatever
column3: 幸亏岩浆不像[水晶矿]那么娇气,你那个移动地面的法术应该不会对它有影响.

column2: oh also the cart cant stop moving otherwise the tank will be emptied.
column3: 哦,还有,矿车停下来的时候这个大罐子也会突然开漏.

column2: dont ask why, thats just how it works my guy.
column3: 别问我为什么,我们尝试修了好多次了.你必须[连续]送两矿车的岩浆过来.

column2: duuuuude you let the cart stop.
column3: 兄弟--你让矿车停下了.

column2: and like the lava is totally gone
column3: 岩浆全漏掉了.

column2: you gotta get 2 carts of lava without stopping
column3: 你需要把两矿车的岩浆运过来,不带停的!

column2: one more bucket. dont let that cart stop.
column3: 还需要一车,不准停!

column2: woah you got two buckets. now we just gotta let it fill.
column3: 哇,两车都到了!现在我们只需要等一等...

column2: Whew! My waterwheel is central to the Crystal Mines! But she's seen better days...
column3: 呼~我的[水车]曾经是水晶矿的中心!但是它已经年久失修了.

column2: Some MRI researcher's coming and she said she needed LOTS of power, so we gotta get fixing.
column3: 有个MRI的研究员告诉我们她需要[很多的电],我们该把水车修好了.

column2: The waterwheel needs flowing water and unfrozen gears. We'll deal with that heater later.
column3: 我们需要给它足够的水流,然后把齿轮解冻.这个[供暖器]我们之后再说.

column2: First things first...
column3: 我们一样样的来...

column2: Golly, if we fill that heater with lava, these gears could turn forever.
column3: 老天,如果我们用[岩浆]来加热,这些齿轮可以一直转下去.

column2: Bada-Bing! Nice and warm!
column3: 热气腾腾!

column2: The waterwheel won't work without any <wavy>flowing</wavy> water!
column3: 水车需要强劲的<wavy>水流</wavy>!

column2: Gah! It looks like some of the gears of the power generation mechanism have frozen over.
column3: 看起来齿轮和发电机完全冻上了.

column2: Think you can unfreeze them?
column3: 嘎!你能给它们解冻吗?

column2: This waterwheel is central to these mines. We need to unfreeze these gears.
column3: 这个水车很重要.我们需要给这些齿轮解冻.

column2: Eep! The gears are unfrozen, but we still need <wavy>flowing</wavy> water!
column3: 耶!齿轮解冻了.但是我们还缺<wavy>水流</wavy>!

column2: Florp! We need to fix the waterwheel, not steal power from the generator.
column3: 嘿!我们的任务是修水车,不是偷电!

column2: That generator is for emergencies only!
column3: 这个电机是专供紧急情况使用的!

column2: Egads! You got the wheel turning again!
column3: 吼!轮子又转起来了!

column2: I hope it's enough power for that researcher.
column3: 希望这些电力足够了.

column2: Zoinks! We should really look into a more permanent heating solution, eh?
column3: 扎!我们可能需要一个更永久的供暖方法...是吧?

column2: Some researcher from MRI is here to study the crystals we've been digging up.
column3: 有个MRI的高材生在这里研究水晶.

column2: They're trying to tap into their power to make a new generation of rocket fuel. Isn't that awesome?!
column3: 她说这些水晶能用来造[火箭燃料].这是真的吗?

column2: Dagnabit! The scientist is here already? I thought she was coming later.
column3: 当!研究员已经来了?

column2: We can't get a sustainable power output until the heater is fixed.
column3: 在供暖修好之前我们没办法持续发电.

column2: If you wanna power that extractor, you're gonna need to get creative.
column3: 如果你想把[水晶萃取机]修好,可能需要一些"想象力".

column2: Gadzooks! That gem extractor looks just as broken as our heater pipe!
column3: 歪!那个[水晶萃取机]看起来和供暖管一样的破烂!

column2: Things were never like this with the boss around...
column3: 老大还在的时候不会这样...

column2: Still no sign of her, eh? Let me know if that changes.
column3: 她还是下落不明?好吧...

column2: Boo-yah! You found my boss!
column3: 压!你找到了老大!

column2: She should be able to help us fix that pipe.
column3: 她应该有修好管子的方法.

column2: Hi not to be weird or anything, but I just had to see how you've been using that <#2e44f0>anchor</color>!
column3: 你好.我当然不是怪人,我只是想说:我知道一些<#2e44f0>船锚</color>的妙用!

column2: This ice patch is a shortcut to the bottom! Provided you've got somewhere to go.
column3: 这个[冰面]是通往下面的捷径--如果你想下去的话.

column2: No more waiting for the elevator to go down!
column3: 你不需要等电梯!

column2: If you find a minecart, I'll show you how it works.
column3: 如果你找到一个[矿车],我可以示范示范.

column2: I helped some dude off a rock, and he said he'd help me out if i left him alone!
column3: 我前一阵帮助过一个卡在石头上的家伙.

column2: Looks like the rails near him line up perfectly with the ones on the ice here.
column3: 他边上的铁轨看起来正好对着冰面--我就是这么发现捷径的.

column2: If you put that tile with the trees on it beneath this one, I'll show you how the shortcut works.
column3: 如果你把那个[带树的地块]挪到我们正下方,我可以演示给你看.

column2: Okay we're ready to go!
column3: 准备好了!

column2: Drop the minecart on the track there, and use the <#2e44f0>anchor</color> to break the ice!
column3: 把矿车放置到轨道上,然后用<#2e44f0>船锚</color>砸开冰面!

column2: Wow, you did it!
column3: 哇,你做到了!

column2: Just another reason that the <#2e44f0>anchor</color> is the best.
column3: <#2e44f0>船锚</color>是最棒的.

column2: If you ever find who made that elevator, let them know about this. They'll be thrilled!
column3: 你该把这个捷径告诉设计电梯的人--这比电梯好用多了.

column2: This shortcut is just the coolest, huh?
column3: 太酷了!

column2: Don't forget to use the <#2e44f0>anchor</color>! It's super useful!
column3: 别忘了<#2e44f0>船锚</color>!它是个好帮手!

column2: The ice is gone forever! It's like a permanent anchor!
column3: 哇,这个供热管就像一个"永久船锚"一样.

column2: Hey! Do you work here? I'm Sara, here to investigate the buzz about these crystals!
column3: 嘿!你是矿场的员工么?我叫萨拉,刚刚到这里没多久.我代表MRI来这里研究[水晶矿石]!

column2: I've been trying to use these crystal extractors and processors but...
column3: 这是我们设计的[水晶萃取机]和[精炼仪],但是...

column2: There's no power!
column3: 附近没有电!

column2: And no crystals!!
column3: 也看不见水晶!!

column2: We need a minecart for the crystals. I think one was trapped behind that big rock.
column3: 我们需要一个[矿车]来把水晶运出来.那边好像有一个压在大石头下面.

column2: Did you find a replacement tank yet?
column3: 你找到替换的[罐子]了吗?

column2: I've got some more of those... what do you call them?
column3: 我有一些...这个叫什么?

column2: Sliders? Okay sure. If you help fix and power the machine I'll give you one of those thingies.
column3: "滑块"?行吧.如果你把这些机器修好,我就给你一个..."滑块".

column2: We've got the power!
column3: 有电了!

column2: But we still need to replace that extraction tank.
column3: 我们还需要换掉那个[罐子].

column2: According to my records, some Burt fella made the original one.
column3: 我找到一本手册上写着,罐子是委托一个叫[波特]的家伙做的.

column2: One last thing I read - these crystals can be dropped a long ways down and be okay!
column3: 手册上还写着--这些水晶不怕摔!

column2: I guess that's why they built this shortcut.
column3: 这条捷径在这里不是没道理的.

column2: Heh, good work.
column3: 好样的.

column2: As nervous as I am, we still need to power the extractor to make that goo.
column3: 没有[电力]是没法提取出燃料的!

column2: Is the waterwheel done yet?? We told them we would need it.
column3: 水车修好了么??他们说会在我来之前修好的!

column2: We've got power! Now let's hope this thing stays stable.
column3: 通电了!希望电压稳定.

column2: Let's make some goo!
column3: 是时候制作燃料了!

column2: I'll need 2 crystals to create the specimen. <wavy>And power</wavy>!!
column3: 我需要[两块水晶]来制作样本.<wavy>还有电能</wavy>!!

column2: Be careful, though. Moving the machine will also dissolve the crystals.
column3: 小心,移动地面会使水晶共振,破坏它们的晶体结构.

column2: And leaving them alone for too long will cause destablization.
column3: 反之,如果让水晶突然停下,它们会变得不稳定!

column2: We have just enough time to get 2 if the minecart is constantly moving when delivering.
column3: 如果矿车[保持移动],一路送到罐子里面,也许我们刚好可以把两块矿石送进去.

column2: So remember... 2 crystals, no shaking the machine, and keep that minecart moving!
column3: 记住...两块水晶,不能移动机器,让矿车保持移动!

column2: The crystals, they shattered!
column3: 水晶碎了!

column2: Make sure not to move the extractor with a crystal inside. These things are unstable!
column3: 萃取机里面的水晶很不稳定!不要动它.

column2: Let's try that again. Bring me 2 crystals. No movement, no minecart stops.
column3: 再试试.两块水晶,机器不能移动,矿车不能停止!

column2: The crystals, they shattered!
column3: 水晶碎了!

column2: These things degrade quickly, it seems. I'll note that.
column3: 它们的衰变速度比我想象的要快.

column2: Make sure to get 2 crystals without the minecart stopping!
column3: 矿车不可以中途停下!

column2: One crystal down, one more to go!
column3: 一车送到了,还差另一车!

column2: It works! It actually works!
column3: 成功了!

column2: Oh look at all this wonderful, gemmy goo.
column3: 完美!燃料做出来了!

column2: You've been a wonderful research partner.
column3: 你很有做实验员的潜力.

column2: You found a minecart!
column3: 你找到了矿车!

column2: Maybe that guy will stop yapping my ear off about the ice patch now.
column3: 那个怪家伙一直在说什么[冰面].

column2: Anyways, we need to power the extractor so we can suck up the crystals.
column3: 不管他了.我们需要给萃取机通电.

column2: Wait until the folks back at the MRI hear about this tech. The rocket program is saved!
column3: 我们的火箭项目有着落了!我需要联系MRI的同事.

column2: We can't process the crystals without power!
column3: 精炼仪也需要通电!

column2: There must be a power source around here somewhere.
column3: 附近一定有个电源.

column2: You hotwired the generator? You're a helluva engineer!
column3: 你连上了发电机?好样的!

column2: Now lets get this extractor loaded up with some crystals. Use the minecart!
column3: 我们现在需要往萃取机里面运一些水晶.

column2: The crystals, they shattered!
column3: 水晶碎了!

column2: Make sure not to move the extractor with a crystal inside. These things are unstable!
column3: 萃取机里面的水晶很不稳定!不要动它.

column2: Let's try that again. Bring me another crystal.
column3: 再送一块水晶过来.

column2: We got the crystals! Now let's get the processor powered.
column3: 我们有水晶了!现在需要给精炼仪通电.

column2: Be careful not to move the machine, or the crystals will disolve!
column3: 小心,不要移动装着水晶的机器.

column2: Alright the processor is all ready to go! This should make some good goop.
column3: 精炼仪准备好了!

column2: Power: check. Crystal: check.
column3: 电源和水晶都找到了.

column2: Let's do this!
column3: 开工!

column2: Oh no ohhhh nooooo...
column3: 哦不!

column2: This... this was not in the manual.
column3: 这...不在手册里面.

column2: Hmm... looks like we're gonna need a replacement tank. Can you get that fixed real quick?
column3: 呃...看起来我们需要替换一个新的罐子.

column2: You found one!
column3: 你找到了!

column2:
DANGER: Thin ice. 
No heavy objects.
column3:
危险:薄冰
严禁摆放重物!

column2: *Sob* They dont *sob* understand
column3: *哭*他们不懂*哭*

column2: I built that elevator over there... fine piece of work, isn't she?
column3: 那边的矿车电梯是我设计的...

column2: But, I made it go up... AND down... but they only ever *sob* use it to go up!
column3: 它可以运矿车上、下楼,但是他们从来不用它下楼...*哭*

column2: "Just drop it through the ice" they say... *sob* "The crystals are fine"
column3: 他们说直接从冰面上摔下去方便多了...*哭*

column2: I can't stand to see my efforts wasted... I can't work like this...
column3: 我堂堂[总工程师]的手艺全浪费了...

column2: I just *sob* want to see the elevator go *sob* down
column3: 我只想看到电梯下楼....*哭*

column2: *Sob* when will... wait a second
You did it! You *sob* actually did it!
column3: 你做到了!

column2: I'm not a failure after all!
column3: 看吧,我没有骗你!

column2: Thank you for demonstrating true bravery.
column3: 谢谢,你是真正的勇士.

column2: Now let's keep inventing!
column3: 是时候继续发明了.

column2: I have so many ideas!
column3: 我有好多点子!

column2: You fixed the pipe? Sorry I was a little *sob* distracted.
column3: 你把管子修好了?*哭*我有点分心了.

column2: Wait there's a researcher here? And she wants to use *my* creations?
column3: 那边的研究员需要我的发明?

column2: That's so *sob* amazing!
column3: 太好了!*哭*

column2: Sorry I can't help, still a little *sob* shaken up.
column3: 抱歉,我眼睛花了.*哭*

column2: The heater works and the waterwheel is *sob* turning again?
column3: 供暖和水车都修好了?*哭*

column2: That's *sob* amazing! Tell that scientist I say thanks.
column3: 太...*哭*太好了!代我谢谢那个科学家.

column2: Oh how they treasure my creations, it brings a tear to my eye. *sob*
column3: 我太感动了.*哭*

column2: We're so close to *sob* having everything fixed, but all the rails are jumbled.
column3: 我们离修好一切*哭*很近了.但是铁路现在一团乱.

column2: You *sob* did it! The Crystal Mines are functional again!
column3: 你做到了!*哭*水晶矿场又能开工了.

column2: You're from the factory right? Tell them everything is working on our end!
column3: 别忘了和工厂那边联系.

column2: My love, what a wonderful honeymoon this has been!
column3: 哦,爱人.我们的蜜月多么美好!

column2: Only the best for you, my love!
column3: 最好的留给你,我的爱人!

column2: Though I dare not think about our descent from these heights...
column3: 不过我有点担心怎么从这里下去...

column2:
DANGER: Explosives.
Do not heat.
column3:
危险:爆炸物
严禁加热!

column2: Our crystal transport cart got trapped in the tunnel collapse.
column3: 隧道塌方的时候把我们的[矿车]压在下面了.

column2: But you know what they say: any problem can be fixed with explosives!
column3: 有高人曾经说过:爆炸半径内没有难题!

column2: But I don't have anything to ignite them... so nothing for now.
column3: 可惜我现在没有任何方法来[引燃]...

column2: If you find something hot enough to blow these up, let me know.
column3: 如果你找到一个足够[热]的东西,记得带到这里来.

column2: Haven't found anything to light these explosives, have you?
column3: 你找到点燃这些爆炸物的办法了么?

column2: I'm getting antsy over here.
column3: 我等不及了.

column2: Okay, this is probably not safe but...
column3: 是时候[解决问题]了--

column2: Promise not to tell anyone?
column3: 说好了,不要告诉安全员!

column2: BOOM! BOOM!! BOOM!!! BOOM!!!!
column3: 爆!爆!爆!

column2: I mean uh... thanks for clearing that up.
column3: 呃...我的意思是...谢谢.

column2: Drop the minecart on these powered rails to give her a little boost.
column3: 这些[动力铁轨]可以给上面的矿车加速.

column2: Wow, look at her go!
column3: 轨道漂移!

column2: All in a days work.
column3: 一天就完工了,好样的.

column2:
Mmmm 
sustinance.
column3:
安全事项全忘光,
下班吃嘛嘛都香.

column2: DANGER: Unstable crystals. Avoid large, sudden movements.
column3: 危险:不稳定水晶.请勿突然挪动!

column2: Welcome to The Crystal Loop!
column3: 欢迎来到[水晶环线]!

column2: Whaaaaaat? You don't have a minecart?
column3: 什么?你连[矿车]也没有?

column2: I'm sorry. These things are too heavy to be moved by hand.
column3: 抱歉了,这些东西只用双手是搬不动的.

column2: Fill that minecart up with crystals!
column3: 把它填满水晶!

column2: Now you be careful with those raw crystals.
column3: 一定要小心.

column2: They're super unstable. Any magical interference will destroy them!
column3: 它们非常不稳定,不能受到任何的[魔力影响]!

column2: You seen all this world-moving nonsense happening lately? Don't do that.
column3: 最近有哪个"魔法师"老是把地面动来动去的,水晶矿禁不住这种魔法!

column2: Oh, but you can drop them down that ice patch. They seem to be fine with just gravity.
column3: 哦,但是它们平时很禁摔的,毕竟重力不是魔法.

column2: Worked here a loooooong time. Seen a lot. But know what I haven't seen?
column3: 我在这里工作好久了,但是有件事我从来没有见过...

column2: Nobody's ever used that lever below me. What's it even for?
column3: 从来没有人动过下面的[操纵杆].它是干什么用的?

column2: Ahaaaaaaaaah that's what the lever does!
column3: 我知道它是干什么的了!!!

column2: There's always so much to learn around here.
column3: 岗位上总能学到新知识.

column2: You're a pro!
column3: 你是专业的!

column2: Remember not to move anything if you want to keep those crystals in tact!
column3: 记住要让水晶远离魔法!

column2: You can drop through that ice patch, though. Seems they do just fine with gravity.
column3: 哦,但是它们平时很禁摔的,毕竟重力不是魔法.

column2: Think anyone would buy these if we sold em?
column3: 这些矿石会有人买么?

column2: I mean people spend too much on fake magic crystals.
column3: 连假的矿石都有人买.

column2: Imagine what they would pay for real magic crystals!
column3: 真的矿石肯定更能卖得更贵吧!

column2: I hope this crappy generator lasts until the waterwheel is finally fixed.
column3: 电梯连着的水车坏了,不知道这个备用发电机能撑多久...

column2: We hooked it up to the minecart elevator real quick but its a bit... jank.
column3: 这个电缆看起来...有些简陋.

column2: Finally, they cleared out the cave in.
column3: 他们终于把矿洞清开了.

column2: The Crystal Extractor needs power too? Uhm... I don't know about this.
column3: 哪个水晶萃取机也需要供电?呃...我想不出办法.

column2: W-what are you doing???
column3: 你在做什么???

column2: ??? You blew up the generator!
column3: ???你炸坏了发电机!

column2: When boss finds out, you're soooo getting fired.
column3: 老大回来第一件事就是炒你的鱿鱼.

column2: Wait. I'm getting fired.
column3: 不对...会不会是我?

column2: Don't worry I think we can fix it haha! We just need to get another Crystal.
column3: 哈哈,我应该能修好的.大概只需要一块水晶....吧...

column2: Phew! The elevator should be fully operational again.
column3: 好了!电梯应该能运转了.

column2: Oh, and I capped off that exposed wire too, so don't get any ideas.
column3: 哦,我把那边暴露的电线封上了,别动你的歪点子!

column2: Boss coulda done better for sure though.
column3: 如果老大在这里,她可不会让你有机可乘.

column2: Sending carts down? I guess you could if it'll make boss happy.
column3: 让矿车[下去]?如果你想让老大开心的话.

column2: Like I guess you could.
column3: 理论上可以.

column2: Great work, boss would be proud.
column3: 好样的!老大会很开心的.

column2: DANGER: Beware of Hot Lava
column3: 危险:小心岩浆

column2: my friend bobbyjim got stranded on the mountaintop... hope it's not too cold up there
column3: 我的朋友包比吉被困在山顶了...希望上面没有太冷.

column2: woah good work
column3: 哇,好样的.

column2: Come on down to Burt's Crafts! Good goods, low prices!
column3: 欢迎来到[波特的手工艺品]!质量上乘,价格优惠!

column2: Once I get my hands on stuff from the Crystal Loop over there, we're gonna have some CRAZY tech.
column3: 我等不及从[水晶环线]那里进货了.用水晶矿肯定能做出什么疯狂的新科技!

column2: An empty minecart? Are you for real?
column3: 一个空的矿车?你认真的?

column2: Bring me some crystals from the Loop, then we can talk about the extraction tank.
column3: 从环线那里带一块[水晶矿]过来,不然我可不会给你做什么罐子.

column2: Those crystals feel really hot and look really red...
column3: 这些水晶看起来...非常的热,还发着红光...

column2: Wait a second, those aren't crystals. It's a minecart of lava!
column3: 不对,这不是水晶,这是岩浆!

column2: I'll keep working on the tank, but don't expect anything until you help get me some crystals from the Loop.
column3: 我可以开工,但是除非你把矿石带过来,我不会交付成果!

column2: Hey, you actually brought me some crystals!
column3: 嘿,你真的把水晶带过来了!

column2: Perfect timing, I just finished up that extraction tank.
column3: 来得正好,我刚把罐子做出来.

column2: Come back soon!
column3: 慢走!

column2: Come back soon!
column3: 慢走!

column2: The things I'm gonna do to these crystals...
column3: 嘿嘿嘿,水晶--

column2: I got plans I cannot share.
column3: 嘘...我的计划不能泄露.

column2: A bucket? Sure, I can give you one of those. Whatchya got to offer?
column3: 一个桶?简单,你出多少?

column2: Nothing? Hmm... next time you better pay up.
column3: 一分钱也没有?好吧...只是这一次,算我帮你的.

column2: Come back again soon!
column3: 慢走!

column2: If you ever need anything else, just let me know.
column3: 需要什么尽管跟我说.

column2: No more freebies, though.
column3: 但别指望我白送你东西了!

column2: You need a minecart?
column3: 你需要一个矿车?

column2: Sorry bub i sold my last one yesterday.
column3: 我们昨天刚把最后一辆卖出去了.

column2: Heard it got trapped behind that giant rock near the Crystal Loop. What a shame.
column3: 听说它掉到[水晶环线]那边的哪个大石头下面了,真可惜.

column2: Sounds like you found the minecart after all.
column3: 你好像找到矿车了.

column2: Tell you what. I'll make you an extraction tank if you get me some crystals from the Loop. Deal?
column3: 如果你从环线那边带一块[水晶矿]过来,我就帮你做一个一模一样的罐子.成交?

column2: An extraction tank? Sure, I can make you one of those. Whatchya got to offer?
column3: MRI订的那种罐子?没问题.你出多少?

column2: Nothing? That won't do this time.
column3: 一分钱也没有?我都说了不再白送了.

column2: You know I've been trying to get some crystals from the Loop, but I could never hash out the directions.
column3: 我一直想鼓捣水晶矿.要不然这样--

column2: Tell you what. I'll make you an extraction tank if you get me some crystals from the Loop. Deal?
column3: 如果你从环线那边带一块[水晶矿]过来,我就帮你做一个一模一样的罐子.成交?

column2: An extraction tank? Sure, I can make you one of those. Whatchya got to offer?
column3: MRI订的那种罐子?没问题.你出多少?

column2: Nothing? That won't do this time.
column3: 一分钱也没有?我都说了不再白送了.

column2: You know I've been trying to get some crystals from the Loop, but I could never hash out the directions.
column3: 你有没有什么其他值钱的东西?比如[水晶矿].

column2: Tell you what. I'll make you an extraction tank if you get me some crystals from the Loop. Deal?
column3: 如果你从环线那边带一块[水晶矿]过来,我就帮你做一个一模一样的罐子.成交?

column2: Hey pal, I'm almost done with that extraction tank.
column3: 嘿,伙计.你订的罐子快完工了.

column2: You still need to pay up, though. In crystals.
column3: 别忘了带矿石来.

column2: I know you can get them over here safe and sound.
column3: 我知道你肯定有办法的.

column2: How do you get the crystals here? Well, if I knew, I would have some.
column3: 你问我怎么做?如果我知道,我还会让你去拿?

column2: That's why we trade. I'll finish up the extraction tank, you get me some crystals.
column3: 自己想办法去!
